intro: Macairea radula, commonly known as the slender macairea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Macairea radula is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
